propel.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move, drive, or push something forward
propel.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a boat propelled by a small motor
One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
She used the sticks to propel herself along.
propel.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make someone move in a particular direction, especially by pushing them
propel.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He took her arm and propelled her towards the door.
propel.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to move someone into a new situation or make them do something
propel.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The film propelled her to stardom.
Company directors were propelled into action.
